page.title: 18ROKEBY CHURCH
page.content: The present{church}of Rokeby was built in 1750.There are only two other churches like Rokeby in the world. This Georgian church is built with the altar facing North,instead of East,as is usual in other churches.The other churches similar in architecture and lay out are in Gwynedd and Tasmainia. Mr.Harrison is not the rector but only the priest in charge which he became in 1967.He thinks of his church as small but impressive.The church which is Church of England is in the parish of Rokeby with Brignall. The oaken font originally was a torch holder and stands in a corner. Some of the stones from the old church in nearby Mortham were used to build the new Rokeby Church.
